meta.content: Message from Superintendent Terri Noe On March 30, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine made an announcement ordering all of Ohio’s public, community, and private K-12 school buildings to be closed to studen…

p.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 16px; line-height: 1.656; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; text-align: left;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: On March 30, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine made an announcement ordering all of Ohio’s public, community, and private K-12 school buildings to be closed to students through Friday, May 1, 2020 due to the coronavirus health crisis. Finneytown Local School Buildings will be closed through Friday, May 1, 2020.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;
background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: We know the Governor’s order to extend the closure of school buildings presents a challenge to our families. Our district is working diligently to partner with you in furthering your child’s education and well-being.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-weight: bold; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: What does this mean for our students?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Although our school buildings are to remain closed, remote learning will continue. We

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: will continue to adjust and administer our virtual learning plans and expectations, provide student services and resources to the best of our ability, and distribute free meals to our students.

p.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 16px; line-height: 1.656; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; padding: 7.5pt 0pt;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: We are experiencing a health crisis that none of us has experienced in our lifetime. There will be bumps along the way, but your child’s teachers, counselors, building principals, and our support staff are here to work with your family to support you, your children and each other.

p.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 16px; line-height: 1.656; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; padding: 7.5pt 0pt 18.5pt;

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: This is the time for our community to come together and navigate through this challenging situation. We have already seen it happen in the last two weeks. This is an amazing community and I am proud to be part of it.

p.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 16px; line-height: 1.656; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; padding: 7.5pt 0pt 18.5pt;

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 16px; line-height: 1.2; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; padding: 7.5pt 0pt 18.5pt;

span.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

Learn more about student learning requirements.

div.p: Finneytown LSD takes care of our students with meals for several days at a time.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-388af94 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-6739424 elementor-position-top elementor-vertical-align-top elementor-widget elementor-widget-image-box

div.p: If any student needs technology assistance or internet service, please reach out here.

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-2f4fb70 elementor-position-top elementor-vertical-align-top elementor-widget elementor-widget-image-box

div.p: Families in the Finneytown LSD who are in need of food or household items, please follow the link to contact a member of our pantry for assistance.

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-3340fef elementor-position-top elementor-vertical-align-top elementor-widget elementor-widget-image-box

div.p: Responses to common questions for our families and students

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-6dc2f5d elementor-testimonial--skin-bubble elementor-testimonial--layout-image_inline elementor-testimonial--align-center elementor-arrows-yes elementor-pagination-type-bullets elementor-widget elementor-widget-testimonial-carousel

div.div: I hope you and your families are staying healthy and adjusting to our "new normal." I have been so impressed and excited by the experiences I'm hearing about and I am touched by everyone's efforts to connect. It is obvious that above all else, you care about the well-being of our students, staff, and one another and I am so grateful to be a part of such a generous community. -Dr. Jen Dinan

This is uncharted territory for all of us - families, students, teachers. We need to lean into each other and make the best of this situation.
Thank you to all of you who are nurses, doctors, first responders, and other essential workers! I am proud to live in our community knowing that we take care of each other making us all Better Together! #flsdBetterTogether

In uncertain times like this, I'm reminded of the importance of community. In the past, our community has risen to the occasion, and this time is no different. I am truly inspired by the ways that we have worked together and connected. I am confident that we will get through this together! #flsdBetterTogether

div.p: Finneytown Local School Buildings will be Closed Through May 29, 2020 I normally send the weekly update in the morning, but had a feeling there may be news to share from the Governor’s broadcast today and there was. Today, April 20, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine made an announcement that school buildings are to remain closed to students through the end of this school year. Finneytown Local School Buildings will be closed through the rest of this school year. We know

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4764 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-covid category-news

div.p: This Monday, April 20th, the FLSD School Board Meeting will occur digitally through Zoom. If you would like to view and/or participate in the meeting in real-time please follow the information below at 7:30 on Monday night. A video of the entire Board Meeting will be posted following the meeting. ZOOM Information Topic: FLSD Board of Education MeetingTime: Apr 20, 2020 07:30 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada) Join Zoom Meetinghttps://zoom.us/j/96213224379?pwd=S2NEM2p3dVZpdlhOQXkzOXgzVUVFZz09 Meeting ID: 962 1322 4379Password: pQJC71

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4744 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-covid category-news

div.p: Notification from: Finneytown Local School District ADMIN Hello wonderful Finneytown Families, Monday, April 6, 2020 Welcome to Remote Learning (RL) Week 3. This is certainly not what I thought we would be doing the first week of April, but here we are. School buildings are closed but teaching and learning continues, albeit very differently. I know this is hard and stressful and I applaud all your efforts. You
